intro: Acrodon bellidiflorus var. viridis, commonly known as the green bellidiflorus acrodon, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and often hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
